杰森·阿尔丁 (Jason Aldean)凭借“ 在小镇尝试一下”视频引起轩然大波四个月后，他声称仍然不明白这些大惊小怪的原因。这位 46 岁的歌手在接受《洛杉矶时报》采访时宣传他刚刚发行的第 11 张录音室专辑《Highway Desperado》 ，他表示歌曲和视频遭到强烈反对，这让他“有点惊讶”。

11/03/2023

“我的意思是，我觉得这首歌可能会引发一场关于国家状况的对话，”他在谈到这首歌时说道，这首歌被批评者标记为支持枪支和一首“ 现代私刑歌曲”，他们说歌词充满了威胁似乎宣扬暴力。 “我们推出这首歌，它所做的一切只是向我表明，有很多人和我有同样的感受，”他在谈到这首一周前在 Billboard Hot 100 上排名第一的歌曲时说道。历史性地从榜首位置跌落。

在错误地声称“正在通过的法律”禁止店主对小偷进行报复之后——《泰晤士报》指出，加州参议院法案的早期版本有一项条款禁止企业要求非保安员工对抗小偷——这位歌手说，他在歌曲的视频中“提出了一个观点”，向人们展示“所有种族和肤色的人都在做我认为不酷的事情”。

阿尔丁在田纳西州哥伦比亚莫里县法院前表演的备受争议的视频——1927 年，18 岁的亨利·乔特 (Henry Choate) 因被指控性侵犯一名白人女孩而被处以私刑并绞死在此处，以及现场讲述了 1946 年一场种族骚乱，两名黑人被杀的故事——在首映后不久就从 CMT 中撤下。

挑战那些“红灯时劫持老太太”、“咒骂警察”或“拔枪指着酒品店老板”的歌词与燃烧美国国旗、抗议者发生冲突的图像并置在一起与警察一起，抢劫者打破了展示柜，小偷抢劫了一家便利店。叙述中还包含了“黑人生命也是命”抗议活动的图片，这些图片在强烈反对后似乎被删除了。

当被问及如果他知道视频拍摄地点众所周知的历史时，他是否会在其他地方拍摄该视频时，阿尔丁表示，这将“更多地是一场对话”，并表示有“很多事情”在同一地点拍摄“并且从未被提起。然后突然，我们的视频出来了。人们试图在什么都没有的地方寻找一些东西。”

当采访者询问诸如“在这里我们照顾自己的”之类的台词是否可能被视为“白人围着马车”，或者至少是“城市混乱的歇斯底里的写照”时，阿尔丁说，“如果您愿意的话，您可以这样认为。但你的理解方式，与我的表达方式和意思相比，并不一定准确。这是一个非常简单的信息：我所看到的正在发生的事情，是我在佐治亚州长大的城镇中从未见过的。它只是不会发生，也不会持续下去。”

阿尔丁还被要求评论他去年在纳什维尔普利司通体育场举行的一场演出，当他提到与这位歌手长期不和的同胞明星马伦·莫里斯时，观众发出了嘘声。莫里斯早些时候曾指责阿尔丁和他的妻子布列塔尼发表了恐跨性言论。莫里斯最近的单曲“The Tree”附有一段视频，该视频被视为对“Try That”剪辑的回应。

“我和她说话的时间从来没有超过 10 秒。所以我对她并没有什么看法，”他谈到莫里斯时说道。 “我唯一知道的是她在媒体上追杀我的妻子。显然，就我们的信仰而言，她和我处于完全不同的两端。但我根本不认识她，真的。这对我来说很奇怪：这个小妞正在追我们​​，而我以前从未和她说过话。但她却声称对我和我妻子了解甚多。”

在闪电般的一轮提问中，阿尔丁被问及拜登总统是否合法当选，他回答说“取决于你问的人”，同时确认他对不接种 COVID-19 疫苗的决定“非常高兴”。至于他是否希望两次被弹劾、四次被起诉的前一任总统唐纳德·特朗普明年成为共和党提名人，他表示这“不会伤害我的感情”。我喜欢特朗普。和他一起出去玩过几次——对我来说非常酷。对于这个家伙，我除了好话之外无话可说。”

经过不到一天的播放，披头士乐队的《Now and Then》首次亮相就在 11 月 11 日的Billboard摇滚与另类音乐播放榜上排名第 37 位。

在10月27日至11月27日期间根据 Luminate 的数据，《Now and Then》在追踪周第二个时段——在美国东部时间上午 10 点首播后，于 11 月 2 日记录了所有的播放量——获得了 110 万次观众印象。这一总数包括根据成人另类 Airplay 调查报告的电台播放量（首日播放次数为 136 次），以及主流摇滚 Airplay 的播放量（通过 27 次检测）。

《Now and Then》是披头士乐队自Billboard摇滚音乐播放榜创始以来第三首进入该榜单的歌曲（1981 年主流摇滚音乐播放榜、1988 年另类音乐播放榜、1996 年成人另类音乐播放榜和 2009 年摇滚与另类音乐播放榜） 。 《Free as a Bird》首次亮相并于 1995 年 12 月在主流摇滚音乐播放排行榜上排名第 8，并在首届成人另类音乐播放排行榜（1996 年 1 月 20 日）中排名第 11，而《Real Love》则在 1996 年 1 月 20 日排名第 11。 1996 年 3 月在成人另类广播节目中排名第 16 位。

《Now and Then》被宣传为披头士乐队的最后一首歌曲，由约翰·列侬 ( John Lennon)在 1970 年代末首次录制为小样，最初是为乐队在 90 年代中期的披头士选集系列而设计的，后来被幸存的成员搁置了。乐队。在新技术帮助从原始演示中提取列侬的声音，同时还使用了乔治·哈里森最初尝试完成这首歌的吉他录音后，该歌曲于今年完成并发行。

《Now and Then》第一周的活动将反映在Billboard 11 月 18 日的排行榜上，包括基于流媒体、播放和销售的Billboard Hot 100 （包括 11 月 3 日至 9 日追踪的活动） 。

11 月 11 日的所有Billboard排行榜将于 11 月 7 日星期二在 Billboard.com 上更新。

; 为什么限制“泰勒版本”风格的重新录制可能会适得其反（客座专栏） https://www.billboard.com/pro/restricting-taylors-version-style-re-recordings-could-backfire-labels/ Fri, 03 Nov 2023 15:31:43 +0000 BusinessRecord Labelsguest columnLegalrecord contractsTaylor's Version https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235462740 Labels should weigh legal and competitive considerations around re-recording restrictions, writes attorney Chris Castle.

律师常说，糟糕的事实会导致糟糕的法律——这意味着案件中不寻常或不太可能的细节可能会以不可预测的方式塑造先例。但糟糕的事实也可能导致糟糕的合同，从泰勒·斯威夫特专辑的“泰勒版”成功后各大唱片公司可能采用的重新录制合同限制来判断。

重新录制限制是一项常见的合同条款，几十年来一直是唱片交易的一部分，旨在作为一种期后竞业禁止。他们的经济目的是可以理解的，即阻止艺术家重新录制根据已经到期的合同发行的歌曲，以使后续唱片公司受益，并让后续唱片与原始唱片竞争，而无需进行可比的投资。按照这种逻辑，重新录制限制的合理期限将是几年，就像“泰勒版本”发行之前的做法一样。很难证明将艺术家锁定很长一段时间（可能比原始录音协议的期限更长）是合理的。

有关的

唱片公司希望防止“泰勒版本”之类的重新录制……

11/03/2023

由于潜在的法律挑战，这一期限也可能受到限制。联邦政府和许多州都限制就业协议中非竞争条款的可执行性，特别是当它们限制经济自由时。 （例子包括《加州商业和职业法典》第 16600 条，以及最近通过的纽约州参议院法案 S3100A ，纽约州州长凯西·霍赫尔 (Kathy Hochul) 预计将签署该法案。）明年，联邦贸易委员会将投票决定完全禁止就业协议中的竞业禁止条款。唱片公司经常说唱片艺术家不是雇员，但这并不一定会把这些限制置于争论之上——特别是如果它们的持续时间比看起来合理的时间长的话。

很少有艺术家会重新录制任何东西，而那些重新录制的人通常只会重温一张或几张热门专辑，最多可能是他们最大的专辑，如果存在合同纠纷，这种情况更有可能发生。对于一位重要的艺术家来说，重新录制他或她的整个目录、重新包装每张专辑并宣传其重新发行，这是史无前例的——特别是当原始热门版本仍然可用时。这需要动力。或者，就斯威夫特而言，也许是挫败感。但在“泰勒版”的世界里，谁愿意成为让这种情况再次发生的人呢？

在不谈《他说她说》出售《Big Machine》（包括斯威夫特的唱片目录）的情况下，重要的是要注意这是一个不寻常的案例。因此，值得询问是否有风险较低的替代方案。

如果一个唱片公司要出售一位在世艺术家的整个作品集，或者出售一家其价值主要由该作品集主导的公司，那么安全的做法可能是为艺术家提供竞标的机会。或者，如果做不到这一点，至少与艺术家协商以创造一个舒适的情况，即使这需要额外的保证或额外的付款。如果您认为只需要做最低限度的事情，那么看看过度墨守成规的方法会发生什么。对于像斯威夫特这样的艺术家来说，这些录音就是他们的生命。

改变录音协议模板以试图保证结果可能会适得其反。 “泰勒版本”根本不是一种正常情况——它涉及世界上最受欢迎的艺术家，她和任何表演者一样对自己的作品有浓厚的兴趣，而且和大多数高管一样具有商业头脑。这是一种几乎无法预料的情况——因此，签订更加片面的合同可能无济于事。相反，这样的变化可能会引起拜登总统领导的联邦贸易委员会的注意，该委员会似乎对非竞争条款有着持久的兴趣。特别是如果多个竞争对手碰巧同时推动相同的合同变更。

有关的

泰勒·斯威夫特改变音乐行业的 9 种方式

11/03/2023

如果唱片公司必须延长重新录制的限制，他们难道不能添加一些甜味剂，例如，如果在世艺术家的唱片目录单独出售，他们将有权匹配最高出价，或者对买家进行封锁或类似的权利？或者，他们也可以不做任何事。

过度的重新录制限制也可能引发艺术家律师的报复。他们可以使后期营销限制和审计等杠杆点变得更加重要，以对抗限制。这意味着不受欢迎的买家可能不得不想知道获得他们所需的批准有多难，或者他们有多希望持续的审核。如果艺术家同时也是主要歌曲作者，买家也可能难以清除歌曲版权，尤其是对于人工智能等新用途。

有关的

泰勒·斯威夫特的《1989》第二次首演会更精彩吗？

11/03/2023

一些唱片公司可能不太关心扩大这一限制，而更关心赢得签下新艺术家的竞争性谈判。如果一个竞争品牌同意更短的限制，这可能是一个简单的妥协，成本很少或不需要。

在合同中添加限制总是存在的诱惑，但在这种情况下，这种做法可能会适得其反。标签可能会被建议要小心他们的愿望。

; 吉米·巴菲特最后一张专辑的制作过程：“他对这张专辑感到非常自豪”，老乐队成员麦克·麦卡纳利说道https://www.billboard.com/music/rock/jimmy-buffett-final-album-feature-mac-mcanally-1235462584/ Fri, 03 Nov 2023 14:11:53 +0000 MusicRockfeatureMusic Newsrock https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235462584 McAnally also reveals Buffett’s reaction to hearing "Bubbles Up," the inspirational first single from ‘Equal Strain on All Parts,' and the Joni Mitchell song in the vault.

今年早些时候，当吉米·巴菲特制作他的第 32 张录音室专辑《Equal Strain on All Parts 》时，他从未承认这可能是他的最后一张专辑。

“我并不一定认为这是他不得不说的最后一件事，但我认为，回想起来，他可能是，”吉他手兼作曲家Mac McAnally说道，他与他的同事 Coral Reefer Band 一起制作了巴菲特的专辑。自 1997 年以来，他一直是迈克尔·厄特利 (Michael Utley) 的好友。他从未屈服于实际发生的事情。”

76 岁的巴菲特在与皮肤癌和淋巴瘤抗争了四年后于 9 月 1 日去世。 “我们组织中有些人不知道他生病了，”麦卡纳利说。 “他不想让任何人为他感到难过。他只是想像往常一样，保持积极的态度。当我在他去世的前一天晚上去向他告别时，他的笑容仍然比脸还宽。”

他们在夏天完成录制后，巴菲特继续修改顺序，因为麦卡纳利意识到这位深受喜爱的创作型歌手正在重新排列歌曲以讲述他的人生旅程。 “当他按顺序听完整张专辑时，他对这张专辑感到非常自豪，这是我从未见过的，”麦卡纳利说。 “这可能是因为他知道这是最后一次，而且他做对了。”

这张专辑于今日（11 月 3 日）在 Mailboat/Sun Records 上发行，以“波旁街大学”开头，将听众带到新奥尔良，这座城市是巴菲特 50 多年前开始职业生涯的地方，并以封面的鲍勃·迪伦的“莫桑比克”，一个他渴望访问的国家。其间有一些自传体歌曲，如“Close Calls”（这首歌让人回想起巴菲特现实生活中的一些冒险经历，包括因《 Walking Tall》而被警长 Buford Pusser 殴打）和“Portugal Or PEI”（葡萄牙或爱德华王子岛），这是巴菲特旅行癖的游记。并在歌词中引用了过去的热门歌曲“火山”和他的突破性歌曲“周一来”。

麦卡纳利说，将以保护大厅爵士乐队为特色的《波旁街》移至第一个位置“是他对排序所做的最后一次修改”。 “它以‘莫桑比克’结尾。”那仍然是他想去其他他从未去过的地方。从他开始的地方到他想去的地方。这是介于两者之间的人生故事。他对这组歌曲投入了很多心思。”

巴菲特一月份开始在纳什维尔的黑鸟工作室剪辑基本曲目，然后回到佛罗里达州基韦斯特的工作室录制人声，在音乐会间隙制作这张专辑，直到五月份停止现场演奏。尽管巴菲特的发声能力有时会根据他的治疗情况而有所波动，但最终，麦卡纳利和厄特利以非常强大的状态捕捉到了巴菲特。 “我认为他在这首歌曲中唱得真的很好，发自内心，”麦卡纳利说。 “如果某件事必须是你最后要说的话，我相信这是一件值得自豪的事情。”

这张包含 14 首歌曲的专辑是巴菲特的经典之作，其中的歌曲代表了他深受几代歌迷喜爱的内容，其中包括与著名作家/专栏作家、巴菲特的老朋友卡尔·希亚森 (Carl Hiaasen) 和麦卡纳利 (McAnally) 共同创作的幽默的《Fish Porn》；随和、逃避现实的“星期五没人工作”；钢鼓排列的“Ti Punch Café”（以 Angelique Kidjo 为主角）；以及深思熟虑、充满向往的“哥伦布”。

巴菲特在“莫桑比克”中加入了他熟悉的岛屿风情。新版本由艾米卢·哈里斯 (Emmylou Harris)演唱，他也在迪伦 1976 年的版本中演唱。 “她感谢我们给她一张歌词表，因为她说当她和迪伦一起唱原曲时，迪伦不会告诉她歌词。 She was just having to watch his mouth,” says McAnally with a laugh.

Buffett, who often posted photos of his Cavalier King Charles Spaniels on his Instagram, also covered “Like My Dog,” a top 30 country hit for Billy Currington in 2011 written by Scotty Emerick and Harley Allen. “Jimmy loved his dogs more than maybe anything on earth except the show,” McAnally says.

Even though there was no talk in the studio about it being the final album, first single, “Bubbles Up,” written by Buffett and Will Kimbrough, serves as a fitting farewell to fans, with its message of hope and resilience. The song was inspired by Buffett participating in Navy SEAL training, including jumping out of a helicopter into the ocean with a weighted pack on his back.

McAnally recalls the advice the admiral overseeing Buffett gave: “'When you're down in the water and you don't know where you are, follow the bubbles. That's how you get to where you're supposed to be.'”

McAnally knew they were on to something special with the song, so much so that he prodded Buffett to replace a vocal recorded earlier in the process. “He generally doesn't like to be pushed in the studio, and I made him go back and work on his vocal,” he says. “I was like, 'This is too good, Jimmy. Let's record it again and really tell the story…' He didn't want it to be slick and polished, he wanted it to sound like a bunch of people around a campfire figuring out what's important about life.”

When McAnally played Buffett the revised version, “He smiled as big as he's ever smiled on the happiest day of his life, but tears just rolling,” he says. “He was like, 'This is so good. Thank you.'”

“Bubbles Up” debuted at No. 1 on Billboard's Rock Digital Song Sales chart for the week ending Sep. 14, according to Luminate. It also started at No. 2 on the Country Digital Song Sales chart. Earlier this week, CMT debuted the emotional video, which includes footage spanning Buffett's adult life and his love for spending time on the water and on the stage.

On a lighter note, the album also includes “My Gummie Just Kicked In,” a song inspired by a line Paul McCartney 's wife, Nancy, jokingly said after she tripped while she and McCartney were out to dinner with Buffett and his wife. McCartney plays bass on the track. Buffett flew to Los Angeles in June to be with McCartney in the studio, while McAnally advised remotely.

“Paul wrote himself out a very detailed Paul McCartney chart to play the song. He put a lot of work into it,” McAnally says. “It's very rare that someone can go in by themselves and overdub on a track that's already been recorded and add energy to it, but Paul McCartney played bass on that track like a 20-year-old Beatle. It's unbelievable.”

The title track, written by Buffett and McAnally and inspired by a saying from Buffett's grandfather, reveals the secret to a good nap is making sure one's body weight is equally distributed. “It takes a second to realize he's talking about something good,” McAnally says.

Cameras captured the recording process and a few behind-the-scenes videos have already rolled out. McAnally says it's possible that a documentary on the making of Equal Strain could be forthcoming. “It will be the final complete project,” he says of the album. “Since we have quite a bit of content that arose from it, I think they'll probably make use of that because there's never a bad time to see that smile on his face.”

Buffett didn't leave a lot of music in the vault, but McAnally says there are some existing tracks he'd also love to see released. There were only two songs recorded for Equal Strain that didn't make the album, but, “We have a few things over the years of Jimmy that are really good,” he says. “There can be a posthumous release, but it will be just literally a collection of things that we did and we never put out for whatever reason. He's got a gorgeous version of Joni Mitchell' s 'Amelia.' I can't believe we didn't put it out when we recorded it.”

McAnally says Buffett's wish was for the Coral Reefer Band , who backed Buffett in various iterations since the '70s, to continue. “The Coral Reefer Band is second family to all of us.我们是一家人。 And Jimmy wants us to continue and we want to continue,” he says. “There's ongoing discussions about the best way to do that, the most practical way to do that and how to do it in a way that is worthy of the legacy that we're part of.”

In the immediate future, McAnally will take part in a tribute to Buffett on Nov. 8's CMA Awards. The salute will also include Zac Brown Band , Kenny Chesney and Alan Jackson , three acts that he'd recorded with and were deeply influenced by him.

It's Friday! That means another spin around the Executive Turntable, Billboard's comprehensive(ish) compendium of promotions, hirings, exits and firings — and all things in between — across the music industry.

Guitar Center tapped longtime board member Gabriel Dalporto to be the musical instrument re-and-etailer's new CEO, effective immediately. The appointment follows the sudden departure of Ron Japinga , who joined the company in 2014 and has served as CEO since 2016. The company gave no reason for Japinga's exit but did stress that he will no longer serve as a member of the board. Other changes in the offing include the return of Tim Martin as chief financial officer and the appointment of Ken C. Hicks as chairman of the board. Dalporto most recently served as CEO of online education platform Udacity, and he previously served in various senior roles at online lender LendingTree. He has been a member of the company's board of directors since 2018. Leading that board, effective immediately, will be Hicks, currently the executive chairman of Academy Sports. Additionally, Martin is back in the CFO spot, which he occupied from 2012-2022. (He spent his break from slinging guitars as COO and CFO of Torrid Holdings, a direct-to-consumer apparel brand specializing in plus-size clothing.)

Sean Michael Gross , the head of WMG's classical music unit in the UK, has added North America to his remit. As vice president of Warner Classics UK & North America , Gross will split his time between London and the States, and continue to report to Warner Classics president Alain Lanceron. The California native joined Warner in 2021 and in that short time has grown the label's market share and workeed with a roster that includes Fatma Said and Abel Selacoe, among others. The Orchard 's largest office outside of NYC has given its co-leaders some title bumps. Effective immediately, Ian Dutt has been elevated from managing director to president of UK operations, while Chris Manning will now put managing director, UK and Europe on his business cards instead of general manager. Both are based in London — where they oversee a team of 150-plus employees and will continue to lead global efforts and day-to-day operations for the Sony-owned distribution company. Dutt joined Orchard in 2016 as part of its merger with Sony RED UK, where he was MD. Manning began his Orchard journey in 2008 and has held a plethora of positions there including label and operations manager, and senior director of international operations. They'll continue to report to Colleen Theis, president and COO. “Ian and Chris will continue to spearhead operations for our artist and label partners, expand our network, and seek out amazing independent talent in our second biggest market,” said Theis. “Together, they are an unparalleled team who work tirelessly to connect our clients from the region to audiences worldwide.”

Bay Area indie label, publisher and distributor EMPIRE elevated industry veteran Elliott Peters to general counsel. Peters, who joined the company in 2020 and was most recently svp of global business, will now oversee EMPIRE's legal and business affairs and be the fine print point person for all deals with DSPs and retailers. Prior to EMPIRE, Peters spent nearly two years as vp of business and legal affairs at SoundCloud, and before that held executive roles at RDIO — as it was being sold to Pandora — and Apple. He kicked off his music industry career in 2000 at Warner Music Group and over the course of 10 years at the major, rose to svp of head of digital and legal affairs. “Elliott has been tremendous in helping EMPIRE scale globally,” said EMPIRE CEO and founder, Ghazi. “As we continue to enter new markets around the world, Elliott will spearhead our efforts worldwide.”

Entertainment business management firm FBMM has named Jen Conger and Erica Rosa as owners. Conger has expertise in royalty analysis, domestic and international touring, sponsorship and endorsement deal negotiations, commercial insurance and estate planning. She oversees over $90 million in revenue each year on behalf of her clients. Conger also became the first female associate business manager in the firm's history, and five years later, was promoted to business manager. Rosa joined FBMM as the firm's first full-time royalty employee and was named vp, royalties and contract compliance in 2021. From 2020 to 2023, she relocated to Los Angeles to help establish the company's Los Angeles office. Rosa has played an essential role in multiple eight- and nine-figure catalog sales and also oversaw unpaid royalty recoveries and prevention of loss revenues of over $200 million.
